segments.text: My argument, build more prisons.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: We need to have a consequence.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: We also need to... Prison doesn't work, though.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Prison does not work.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Listen, I have grown up... We need to punish.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: I've grown up in some of these communities that you guys are talking about, and prison always... It's not a deterrent.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: If you don't change the environment, you won't change anything, and that's the key thing.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: This has been happening for years, okay?
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Years, yeah?
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: And it's not always in the media, but it won't change.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: There is a massive place for rehabilitation.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: It's going to take several things to come together.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Yes, policing is one thing, but at the end of the day, all of you guys on that side, you've benefited, yeah, from the environment that you've grown up in, okay?
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: You've benefited from being in this work environment.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: I've benefited from it.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: But these boys, not all of them get to benefit from the environment.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: If we don't show them something else...
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: you won't change it.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: I was sat there in a way actually getting enraged because it's quite hard for me as a mixed race person that has grown up in some of the areas that these boys come from just to sit back and say nothing.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: It's easy to point the finger when you've not actually lived that life.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: Just throwing stop and search out there as a way to kind of fix it all is not the answer.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: What we see
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: you know in the media it's the end result you don't see that person that young boy that young black boy as a child you know it's like the media we have a responsibility to portray these stories you know correctly you know it's important to balance them and to also
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: you know, show the role models that are out there because there's hundreds of young black boys, young black men that are positive role models in their community.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: But whenever we have these debates on television, you often find that the people that are being debated
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: aren't always represented on the programme.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: In hindsight, it would be lovely to have someone from the community come on and balance the argument and actually talk from experience.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: For me, as a mixed race person, you know, my dad's black, you know, I feel very connected with my community.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: I can't just sit back and not say anything, you know.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: That's why I had to shout across the studio floor, especially when they were talking about
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: building more prisons prison isn't the answer i've spoken to young boys young men that say that prison is not a deterrent they're not scared of going to prison don't put these boys into prison if you can help it that's what i say teach them something else show them a different way because often that's when you you lose
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: young boys into the system forever.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00

segments.text: They go into prison often for doing something quite petty and then they join up with other like-minded people that give them other ways in which they can commit crime.
segments.speaker: SPEAKER_00
